channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The drain on the East side of Lansdown Parade appears blocked and causes significant flooding across the road and pavement., 26th September
item.description:
The drain opposite number 4 and 5 Lansdown Parade is blocked. This is an ongoing problem and has flooded the road on numerous occasions. This has been reported to Cheltenham Council previously and no action has been taken. The flooding creates significant risk for vehicles and is major hazard for pedestrians both of injuries from falling on flooded pavement as well as being soaked by spray from vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Lansdown Crescent, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wainlode Lane severely flooded at Cook Lane andbeyond, 26th September
item.description:
Third flood in last five days at Wainlode Lane/Cook Lane. Water level has not fallen since early morning and raining again now with more heavy rain forecast overnight. Flood water now only a few feet from my property

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Someone has dumped gas cans., 26th September
item.description:
Early this morning someone dumped gas bottles on the road. They are the type used for roofing. About 6 cans. My elderly neighbour who has dementia has been looking at them in the rain. They are on the grass now on the verge opposite my house.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jesson Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris build up ON and Under Bridge restricting water flow, 26th September
item.description:
Debris build up ON and Under Bridge restricting water flow, Bridge accessed from Cherston Court road over Brook. Water ON top of bridge
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 26th September
item.description:
Hit a very large pothole thats has caused damaged to his tyre/wheel, its a large square looks like its been cut out - caim form emailed out under ref 11468493
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover loose and off, exposing a large and deep hole, 26th September
item.description:
Drain/manhole cover immediately next to the Lane had come off exposing a deep, large, dangerous hole. Opposite Yarnton Ley, Between The Meadows and Langton Ley.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butt's Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding due to blocked drains, 26th September
item.description:
Flooding due to blocked drains at Blacksmith`s Lane, The Leigh. Blocked lane twice this week (Monday-Tuesday 23rd/24th September, and further flooding today, Thursday 26th September. Lane impassable and more rain forecast later today/overnight. Elderly residents and families with young children are affected. Drains damaged and/or blocked. Location outside The Croft, Blacksmith`s Lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmiths Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two large piles of dog poo, 26th September
item.description:
Please could these be cleaned up - sorry!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: The only drain at the end of a gully is almost blocked. I'm retired and I havent seen any, 26th September
item.description:
The drain at the end of a street gully is nearly blocked. The drain is outside of 22 Lee Close, Cheltenham, GL51 7JQ. As this is the only drain on our side of the street I'm concerned that if it did block completely it will flood the local houses. I've been retired for over ten years and have never seen the drain pumped out like you see in other streets.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marchant Close, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 26th September
item.description:
Customer reports that the TS at the location have been hit by a vehicle and are now facing the wrong way on this one-way street.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: There is a useless drain due to its position at the end of Woodgate Close & footpath. I was unable to add video. But the road floods due to only 1 drain from 3 collecting the water and i received a shower while trying to film Do not send someone on a day when we have not had heavy rain., 26th September
item.description:
On A40 at bottom of Woodgate Close & footpath that runs alongside hotel.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Woodgate Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on innsworth lane, 26th September
item.description:
On the corner of innsworth lane and dry meadow lane. The flooding blocks the road and enters into my garden to about 3inches deep.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light with no sensor causing chaos, 26th September
item.description:
T junction of The Bank and High street. The temporary traffic lights are not on a sensor, therefore are causing chaos in the village, last night the queue at rush hour was about 1/2 mile in two directions. From The Bank there were no cars waiting and the lights were on green! Please address this issue immediately thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Bank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 26th September
item.description:
Customer reports that the drains at the location are blocked. They state that this is a historic issue which has been reported, repeatedly, over the last 45 years. Water is currently flowing down the road; when vehicles drive through this the water is hitting their dry stone wall and progressively eroding it; it is now leaning. Please can Highways investigate.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discharge from roadworks will end up blocking drains further down the road, 26th September
item.description:
After heavy rains rubble from the roadworks has been swept further down the road, outside the layby at the beginning of 3-7 Gretton Road. This is likely to be swept up by further rains into the drainage system further down the road unless it is cleared.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 26th September
item.description:
The traffic lights at Sixways are almost completely obscured by foliage, can it be trimmed back please.
Report on FixMyStreet
